page.title: 01Moorland SW of Barrhill
page.content: This area is primarily a forested area; controlled and run by the F.C, with the local manager having his home and office in Barrhill village. Barrhill Station (railway) is situated to the north of the block and services Barrhill area & the nearest town of Newton Stewart, for passenger traffic. The station is manned by local people. The farms in the area are mainly hill farms running sheep and beef cattle. Only one farm, Altercannoch, has any appreciable amount of arable land. This area is important historically as a Covenanter centre, and has a monument to two Covenanter martyrs. The Cross-Water River runs diagonally through this sector.
